io.leonis.zosma.math.filter

Class ExtendedKalmanFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.leonis.zosma.math.filter.ExtendedKalmanFilter

  • public class ExtendedKalmanFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class ExtendedKalmanFilter. This class represents an extended Kalman filter (EKF) for nonlinear applications. The implementation is based off of notes and equations which can be found here.

      Computes the filtered Distribution (mean and covariance) using the supplied state- and measurement-transition functions, their respective Jacobians and the supplied control input, process noise, observation noise, and current state.

      Computes the filtered Distribution (mean and covariance) using the supplied state-, measurement-, and control-transition matrices, and the supplied control input, process noise, observation noise, and current state.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public Distribution apply(org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray stateTransitionMatrix,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray measurementTransitionMatrix,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray controlTransitionMatrix,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray controlInput,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray processCovariance,
                          Distribution observationNoise,
                          Distribution state)
        Computes the filtered Distribution (mean and covariance) using the supplied state-, measurement-, and control-transition matrices, and the supplied control input, process noise, observation noise, and current state.
        Parameters:
        stateTransitionMatrix - The state-transition matrix used in projecting the Distribution.
        measurementTransitionMatrix - The measurement-transition matrix used in computing the measurement based on the supplied state.
        controlTransitionMatrix - The control-transition matrix used in computing the effect of the control input on the resultant Distribution.
        controlInput - The control input.
        processCovariance - the process covariance
        observationNoise - The Distribution of observation noise
        state - The Distribution of the latest state.
        Returns:
        The filtered state.

      • apply

        public Distribution apply(java.util.function.BiFunction<org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray,org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray,org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray> stateTransition,
                          java.util.function.Function<org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray,org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray> measurementTransition,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray stateTransitionJacobian,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray measurementTransitionJacobian,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray controlInput,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray processCovariance,
                          Distribution observationNoise,
                          Distribution state)
        Computes the filtered Distribution (mean and covariance) using the supplied state- and measurement-transition functions, their respective Jacobians and the supplied control input, process noise, observation noise, and current state.
        Parameters:
        stateTransition - A BiFunction which takes as its first argument the previous state, and the control input as its second argument. The result is the next state.
        measurementTransition - A Function which takes as its first argument the current state and returns the measurement.
        stateTransitionJacobian - The Jacobian representing the state-transition.
        measurementTransitionJacobian - The Jacobian representing the measurement-transition.
        controlInput - The control input.
        processCovariance - the process covariance
        observationNoise - The Distribution of observation noise
        state - The Distribution of the latest state.
        Returns:
        The filtered state.
